      • hash

        public Hash hash(String plain)
        Description copied from interface: HashingFunction
        Creates a Hash from a plaintext password. Depending on the implementation, the hash may contain the information about salt and pepper.

        The salt is always generated randomly.

        The generation of the salt is completely responsibility of the implementing class.

        Parameters:
        plain - the password to be hashed
        Returns:
        a Hash
        See Also:
        HashingFunction.hash(String, String)

      • hash

        public Hash hash(String plain,
                 String salt)
        Description copied from interface: HashingFunction
        Creates a Hash from a plaintext password and a salt. Depending on the implementation, the hash may contain the information about salt and pepper.

        Some CHFs validate the format of the salt; if the validation is not passed a BadParametersException is thrown. The generation of the salt is completely responsibility of the caller.

        Parameters:
        plain - the password to be hashed
        salt - the salt used in the hashing process
        Returns:
        a Hash

      • check

        public boolean check(String plain,
                     String hashed)
        Description copied from interface: HashingFunction
        Checks if the CHF generated the hash starting from the plaintext password.

        This method must be used when the salt is part of the hash. If the CHF expects a salt separated from the hash, an UnsupportedOperationException is thrown.

        In case the CHF expects a salt to be part of the hash, if the format of the hash is not valid (e.g. the CHF cannot recognise a valid salt) a BadParametersException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        plain - the plaintext password
        hashed - the hash
        Returns:
        true if the hash is generated from the plaintext; false otherwise
